summary: The Renewable Fuel Standard aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and expand the nation’s renewable fuels sector through 2022. It requires that transportation fuels (such as gasoline and diesel) sold in the U.S. contain annually increasing amounts of conventional renewable fuels (such as ethanol) and advanced biofuels (such as cellulosic biofuel). Advanced biofuels can reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least half compared to petroleum-based...
title: Renewable Fuel Standard: Program Unlikely to Meet Production or Greenhouse Gas Reduction Targets
